(decodeWidth, power_switching).explanation: Increasing decode width requires more transistors and logic gates to operate simultaneously, directly increasing switching activity and power consumption;

(decodeWidth, time).explanation: Decode width is a design parameter that affects performance but does not directly determine execution time, which depends on workload and other factors;

(decodeWidth, cpi).explanation: Wider decode width allows more instructions to be decoded per cycle, potentially reducing cycles per instruction by improving instruction-level parallelism;
